result.text: Carnival Corporation shows financial recovery post-COVID, but its balance sheet remains more leveraged than pre-pandemic levels. Management hints at resuming buybacks or dividends, but offers no timeline, maintaining debt reduction as a key focus.

result.title: Carnival: Drifting Along With Shareholders' Returns
result.text: Carnival Corporation & plc, once a leader in leisure travel, has dramatically declined from its former glory while the shareholders are silently ripped off through dilution of their stake in the business. The pandemic exposed CCL's vulnerabilities, its dependencies, and its obsolescence in the global economy. Reinvestments in the business will likely remain the main growth driver, attracting customers and enabling the business to expand.
